instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance in the classification of land cover types and how far can this metric go in assessing accuracy?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the classifiers in this study was the kappa statistic, F1-score, and Matthews correlation coefficient. These metrics were used in the assembly of the voting methods. 

The kappa statistic is a measure of agreement between the predicted and actual classifications, taking into account the agreement that could occur by chance. It ranges from -1 to 1, where 1 indicates perfect agreement and values close to 0 indicate agreement no better than chance.

The F1-score is a measure of the classifier's accuracy, taking into account both precision and recall. It ranges from 0 to 1, where 1 indicates perfect accuracy.

The Matthews correlation coefficient is a measure of the quality of binary classifications, taking into account true positives, true negatives, false positives, and false negatives. It ranges from -1 to 1, where 1 indicates perfect classification and -1 indicates total disagreement.

These metrics provide a comprehensive assessment of the classifiers' performance in terms of accuracy, agreement, and quality of classification.
